comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Ms. Bergman seems to be standing in front of New York's Washington Market. See notes and photo links under: This picture in the series has the clearest view of both the bottom and top of the facade. Compare: www.shorpy.com/node/1149?size=_original#caption

comment.author: 69005233@N00
comment._content: This is probably Alene Bergmann, daughter of Francis & Nellie Bergmann, born in the Bronx in April 1900.  Her father was of German descent, and her mother of Swedish.  They lived in the Bronx and in Brooklyn (found in 1900, 1910, 1920 US census and 1915 NY State Census.  In the 1920 census her occupation was given as "model in a hat shop".  By 1925, she had married Raymond Walter and they had one daughter Virginia.  (found in 1930 and 1940 US Census).    I'm adding this here so that one day, one of her descendants might google her name and find her. :)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: She looks to be about the right age, I agree.
